column5: Well I gave it one more go from shore today with my friend Mike.We tried for some steel heads and browns it just was not our day today.Another beautiful day not too cold.We tried worms lures spoons the whole works but the fishies were hanging out with St.Nick.   The outting started last night with 25 minutes to catch some(8) dew worms.Lets just say Rich from Dover inspired me to get out there.Could not buy worms anywhere.   The drive too the fishing hole.     Montreal from Far away.  The hot spot that was not.Not Today .Next were movin on.  My friend Mike who invited me to fish this area .    Yes I am tryin but I am not cryin.  I am still wishing.Break time.Next spot.      Another hotspot that let us down.Next.      Another spot but no trout.Gotta keep movin.  I just got stopped by a couple taking a walk and they asked if they could take my picture.i asked them to take one with mine.Next fishing spot coming up.      the day is coming to an end.  Thats it I have to call it a day after all it is Christmas Eve. Mike and I did not catch anything but we did have a great day. With weather like this I will be back at it soon.  To all you Great OFC people.Merry Christmas.  Mike the Pike............(Skunked)

way to go mike,well at least you got to go out all day with decent weather right,oh well better luck next time,and a merry christmas to you as well from our family to yours,  and all the best ,and good fishing luck in the new year.and all those scenery shots were great,there sure is alot of water & curent in that mighty st.lawrence river...cool

Well it looked like it was a nice day for you to be out - don't worry about the lack of fish - they're still there - waiting for the next trip   Thanks for the post Mike  - and a very merry Christmas to you and your family.   Hope Santa brings you everything your hoping for   Don
Mike the Pike,  Belle effort sur le st laurent, c'est une bonne place pour l'alose, ne c'est pas?  David  aka  Superdad

Dave I am impressed that after all those years you managed to retain some french.And you wrote it very well.As for me I can speak it well but to write french thats pretty hard.If you come back to Quebec speaking french like that the woman will be after you Dave.  Merry Christmas to you and your family. Thanks for a great year of walleye reports.Mike
By any chance were you fishing the Lachine rapids?
Yes they are the Lachine Rapids.Mike
hey mike awesome report.. me i was up north enjoying the 7 inches of ice to be had:)
Those pictures are awesome.  I love the hats.  Joey
